docs.snippet: Scientists have mapped how a group of fearsome, massive dinosaurs evolved and shrank to the likes of robins and hummingbirds....

headline.main: Study Traces Dinosaur Evolution Into Early Birds
headline.print_headline: Study Traces Dinosaur Evolution Into Early Birds

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have mapped how a group of fearsome, massive dinosaurs evolved and shrank to the likes of robins and hummingbirds.

docs.snippet: Amid rancorous debate over other weighty issues Thursday on Capitol Hill, lawmakers wondered aloud whether driving cars after smoking marijuana is dangerous. Among the unanswered questions: Would drivers who are "high" travel too fast or too slow ...

headline.main: Driving High Questioned on Busy Day in Congress
headline.print_headline: Driving High Questioned on Busy Day in Congress

docs.lead_paragraph: Amid rancorous debate over other weighty issues Thursday on Capitol Hill, lawmakers wondered aloud whether driving cars after smoking marijuana is dangerous. Among the unanswered questions: Would drivers who are "high" travel too fast or too slow for safety?

docs.snippet: The defense team in the Blackwater trial attacked the testimony of a key prosecution witness Thursday, telling a jury that the witness lied to federal investigators even after he had sworn to tell the truth in an effort to win leniency in the case...

headline.main: Ex-Blackwater Guard Says Didn't Feel Threatened
headline.print_headline: Ex-Blackwater Guard Says Didn't Feel Threatened

docs.lead_paragraph: The defense team in the Blackwater trial attacked the testimony of a key prosecution witness Thursday, telling a jury that the witness lied to federal investigators even after he had sworn to tell the truth in an effort to win leniency in the case surrounding the killings of 14 Iraqis.

docs.snippet: A Kansas man faces a first-degree murder charge after his 10-month-old foster daughter died when she was left in a hot car for more than two hours as outdoor temperatures reached about  90 degrees, officials said on Thursday....

headline.main: Kansas Man Who Left Child in Hot Car Is Charged With Murder
headline.print_headline: Kansas Man Who Left Child in Hot Car Is Charged With Murder

docs.lead_paragraph: A Kansas man faces a first-degree murder charge after his 10-month-old foster daughter died when she was left in a hot car for more than two hours as outdoor temperatures reached about  90 degrees, officials said on Thursday.

docs.snippet: Mosaicism is more common than once thought and can lead to diseases in the children of those with more than one genome, a study says....

headline.main: Having More Than One Set of DNA Carries Legacy of Risk
headline.print_headline: Parents Can Pass Genes That May Surprise Them

docs.abstract: Research suggests that mosaicism, state in which people carry two or more significantly different genomes, is more common than once thought and can lead to diseases in offspring of mosaic parents.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mosaicism is more common than once thought and can lead to diseases in the children of those with more than one genome, a study says.

docs.snippet: Booms of outgoing artillery shaking the ground, militia fighters from the remote Libyan mountain town of Zintan hunker down in the passenger terminal to defend Tripoli airport, the biggest prize in the capital....

headline.main: Town vs. Town, Faction vs. Faction as Libya Descends Into 'Hurricane'
headline.print_headline: Town vs. Town, Faction vs. Faction as Libya Descends Into 'Hurricane'

docs.lead_paragraph: Booms of outgoing artillery shaking the ground, militia fighters from the remote Libyan mountain town of Zintan hunker down in the passenger terminal to defend Tripoli airport, the biggest prize in the capital.

docs.snippet: Baltimore Ravens Pro Bowl running back Ray Rice, who has been suspended by the National Football League without pay for the first two games of the 2014 season for hitting his wife, apologized to her on Thursday and vowed to speak out against domes...

headline.main: NFL's Rice Publicly Apologizes to Wife for Violent Incident
headline.print_headline: NFL's Rice Publicly Apologizes to Wife for Violent Incident

docs.lead_paragraph: Baltimore Ravens Pro Bowl running back Ray Rice, who has been suspended by the National Football League without pay for the first two games of the 2014 season for hitting his wife, apologized to her on Thursday and vowed to speak out against domestic violence.

docs.snippet: “Get On Up,” directed by Tate Taylor (“The Help”), tells the story of the R&B and funk singer James Brown....

headline.seo: ‘Get On Up’ Stars Chadwick Boseman as James Brown

docs.abstract: Stephen Holden reviews film Get On Up, directed by Tate Taylor and starring Chadwick Boseman.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Get On Up,” directed by Tate Taylor (“The Help”), tells the story of the R&B and funk singer James Brown.

docs.snippet: Europe's biggest construction and concessions company, Vinci, warned it expects a slowdown in the second half of 2014, especially outside Europe, and a slight decrease in its revenue for the year on a like-for-like basis....

headline.main: Vinci Sees Second-Half Slowdown, Pays Special Dividend
headline.print_headline: Vinci Sees Second-Half Slowdown, Pays Special Dividend

docs.lead_paragraph: Europe's biggest construction and concessions company, Vinci, warned it expects a slowdown in the second half of 2014, especially outside Europe, and a slight decrease in its revenue for the year on a like-for-like basis.

docs.snippet: Israel will be required under international law to take responsibility for helping Palestinian civilians if there are any further large-scale displacements from the fighting in Gaza, a top U.N. envoy told the United Nations Security Council on Thu...

headline.main: Israel May Be Required to Help Displaced Gaza Palestinians: U.N. Envoy
headline.print_headline: Israel May Be Required to Help Displaced Gaza Palestinians: U.N. Envoy

docs.lead_paragraph: Israel will be required under international law to take responsibility for helping Palestinian civilians if there are any further large-scale displacements from the fighting in Gaza, a top U.N. envoy told the United Nations Security Council on Thursday.
